verses.verse: When Jethro, <WH3503> the priest <WH3548> of Midian, <WH4080> Moses' <WH4872> father-in-law, <WH2859> heard <WH8085> <WH853> of all <WH3605> that <WH834> God <WH430> had done <WH6213> for Moses, <WH4872> and for Israel <WH3478> his people, <WH5971> and that <WH3588> the LORD <WH3068> had brought Israel out <WH3318> <WH853> <WH3478> of Egypt; <WH4480> <WH4714>
Then Jethro, <WH3503> Moses' <WH4872> father-in-law, <WH2859> took <WH3947> <WH853> Zipporah, <WH6855> Moses' <WH4872> wife, <WH802> after <WH310> he had sent her back, <WH7964>

And her two <WH8147> sons; <WH1121> of which <WH834> the name <WH8034> of the one <WH259> was Gershom; <WH1648> for <WH3588> he said, <WH559> I have been <WH1961> an alien <WH1616> in a strange <WH5237> land: <WH776>

And the name <WH8034> of the other <WH259> was Eliezer; <WH461> for <WH3588> the God <WH430> of my father, <WH1> said he, was mine help, <WH5828> and delivered <WH5337> me from the sword <WH4480> <WH2719> of Pharaoh: <WH6547>

And Jethro, <WH3503> Moses' <WH4872> father-in-law, <WH2859> came <WH935> with his sons <WH1121> and his wife <WH802> unto <WH413> Moses <WH4872> into <WH413> the wilderness, <WH4057> where <WH834> <WH8033> he <WH1931> encamped <WH2583> at the mount <WH2022> of God: <WH430>

And he said <WH559> unto <WH413> Moses, <WH4872> I <WH589> thy father-in-law <WH2859> Jethro <WH3503> am come <WH935> unto <WH413> thee, and thy wife, <WH802> and her two <WH8147> sons <WH1121> with <WH5973> her.

And Moses <WH4872> went out <WH3318> to meet <WH7125> his father-in-law, <WH2859> and did obeisance, <WH7812> and kissed <WH5401> him; and they asked <WH7592> each <WH376> other <WH7453> of their welfare; <WH7965> and they came <WH935> into the tent. <WH168>

And Moses <WH4872> told <WH5608> his father-in-law <WH2859> <WH853> all <WH3605> that <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> had done <WH6213> unto Pharaoh <WH6547> and to the Egyptians <WH4714> for <WH5921> Israel's <WH3478> sake, <WH182> and <WH853> all <WH3605> the travail <WH8513> that <WH834> had come upon <WH4672> them by the way, <WH1870> and how the LORD <WH3068> delivered <WH5337> them.

And Jethro <WH3503> rejoiced <WH2302> for <WH5921> all <WH3605> the goodness <WH2896> which <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> had done <WH6213> to Israel, <WH3478> whom <WH834> he had delivered <WH5337> out of the hand <WH4480> <WH3027> of the Egyptians. <WH4714>

And Jethro <WH3503> said, <WH559> Blessed <WH1288> be the LORD, <WH3068> who <WH834> hath delivered <WH5337> you out of the hand <WH4480> <WH3027> of the Egyptians, <WH4714> and out of the hand <WH4480> <WH3027> of Pharaoh, <WH6547> who <WH834> hath delivered <WH5337> <WH853> the people <WH5971> from under <WH4480> <WH8478> the hand <WH3027> of the Egyptians. <WH4714>

Now <WH6258> I know <WH3045> that <WH3588> the LORD <WH3068> is greater <WH1419> than all <WH4480> <WH3605> gods: <WH430> for <WH3588> in the thing <WH1697> wherein <WH834> they dealt proudly <WH2102> he was above <WH5921> them.

And Jethro, <WH3503> Moses' <WH4872> father-in-law, <WH2859> took <WH3947> a burnt offering <WH5930> and sacrifices <WH2077> for God: <WH430> and Aaron <WH175> came, <WH935> and all <WH3605> the elders <WH2205> of Israel, <WH3478> to eat <WH398> bread <WH3899> with <WH5973> Moses' <WH4872> father-in-law <WH2859> before <WH6440> God. <WH430>

And it came to pass <WH1961> on the morrow, <WH4480> <WH4283> that Moses <WH4872> sat <WH3427> to judge <WH8199> <WH853> the people: <WH5971> and the people <WH5971> stood <WH5975> by <WH5921> Moses <WH4872> from <WH4480> the morning <WH1242> unto <WH5704> the evening. <WH6153>

And when Moses' <WH4872> father-in-law <WH2859> saw <WH7200> <WH853> all <WH3605> that <WH834> he <WH1931> did <WH6213> to the people, <WH5971> he said, <WH559> What <WH4100> is this <WH2088> thing <WH1697> that <WH834> thou <WH859> doest <WH6213> to the people? <WH5971> why <WH4069> sittest <WH3427> thou <WH859> thyself alone, <WH905> and all <WH3605> the people <WH5971> stand <WH5324> by <WH5921> thee from <WH4480> morning <WH1242> unto <WH5704> even? <WH6153>
And Moses <WH4872> said <WH559> unto his father-in-law, <WH2859> Because <WH3588> the people <WH5971> come <WH935> unto <WH413> me to inquire <WH1875> of God: <WH430>

When <WH3588> they have <WH1961> a matter, <WH1697> they come <WH935> unto <WH413> me; and I judge <WH8199> between <WH996> one <WH376> and another, <WH7453> and I do make them known <WH3045> <WH853> the statutes <WH2706> of God, <WH430> and his laws. <WH8451>
And Moses' <WH4872> father-in-law <WH2859> said <WH559> unto <WH413> him, The thing <WH1697> that <WH834> thou <WH859> doest <WH6213> is not <WH3808> good. <WH2896>

Thou wilt surely wear away, <WH5034> <WH5034> both <WH1571> thou, <WH859> and <WH1571> this <WH2088> people <WH5971> that <WH834> is with <WH5973> thee: for <WH3588> this thing <WH1697> is too heavy <WH3515> for <WH4480> thee; thou art not <WH3808> able <WH3201> to perform <WH6213> it thyself alone. <WH905>

Hearken <WH8085> now <WH6258> unto my voice, <WH6963> I will give thee counsel, <WH3289> and God <WH430> shall be <WH1961> with <WH5973> thee: Be <WH1961> thou <WH859> for the people <WH5971> to Godward, <WH4136> <WH430> that thou <WH859> mayest bring <WH935> <WH853> the causes <WH1697> unto <WH413> God: <WH430>

And thou shalt teach <WH2094> them <WH853> ordinances <WH2706> and laws, <WH8451> and shalt show <WH3045> them <WH853> the way <WH1870> wherein they must walk, <WH1980> and the work <WH4640> that <WH834> they must do. <WH6213>

Moreover thou <WH859> shalt provide <WH2372> out of all <WH4480> <WH3605> the people <WH5971> able <WH2428> men, <WH376> such as fear <WH3373> God, <WH430> men <WH376> of truth, <WH571> hating <WH8130> covetousness; <WH1215> and place <WH7760> such over <WH5921> them, to be rulers <WH8269> of thousands, <WH505> and rulers <WH8269> of hundreds, <WH3967> rulers <WH8269> of fifties, <WH2572> and rulers <WH8269> of tens: <WH6235>

And let them judge <WH8199> <WH853> the people <WH5971> at all <WH3605> seasons: <WH6256> and it shall be, <WH1961> that every <WH3605> great <WH1419> matter <WH1697> they shall bring <WH935> unto <WH413> thee, but every <WH3605> small <WH6996> matter <WH1697> they <WH1992> shall judge: <WH8199> so shall it be easier <WH7043> for <WH4480> <WH5921> thyself, and they shall bear <WH5375> the burden with <WH854> thee.

If <WH518> thou shalt do <WH6213> <WH853> this <WH2088> thing, <WH1697> and God <WH430> command <WH6680> thee so, then thou shalt be able <WH3201> to endure, <WH5975> and all <WH3605> this <WH2088> people <WH5971> shall also <WH1571> go <WH935> to <WH5921> their place <WH4725> in peace. <WH7965>
So Moses <WH4872> hearkened <WH8085> to the voice <WH6963> of his father-in-law, <WH2859> and did <WH6213> all <WH3605> that <WH834> he had said. <WH559>

And Moses <WH4872> chose <WH977> able <WH2428> men <WH376> out of all <WH4480> <WH3605> Israel, <WH3478> and made <WH5414> them heads <WH7218> over <WH5921> the people, <WH5971> rulers <WH8269> of thousands, <WH505> rulers <WH8269> of hundreds, <WH3967> rulers <WH8269> of fifties, <WH2572> and rulers <WH8269> of tens. <WH6235>

And they judged <WH8199> <WH853> the people <WH5971> at all <WH3605> seasons: <WH6256> the hard <WH7186> <WH853> causes <WH1697> they brought <WH935> unto <WH413> Moses, <WH4872> but every <WH3605> small <WH6996> matter <WH1697> they judged <WH8199> themselves. <WH1992>
And Moses <WH4872> let <WH853> his father-in-law <WH2859> depart; <WH7971> and he went his way <WH1980> into <WH413> his own land. <WH776>
